title: Duplicate instance of a static variable when accessed from sub-crate

labels.name: A-linkage
labels.description: Area: linking into static, shared libraries and binaries

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
If I have a `static` variable in a lib and access it from a "sub-crate", the sub-crate appears to create a separate instance of the variable, which is unexpected to me.

I created a minimal project showcasing the issue at https://gitlab.com/Fraser999/subcrate_static_issue:
```
git clone https://gitlab.com/Fraser999/subcrate_static_issue.git
cd subcrate_static_issue
cargo test -- --nocapture
```
The output I'd expect would be:
```
VALUE is 1 after being incremented by subcrate_static_issue.
VALUE is 2 after being incremented by subcrate_static_issue.
VALUE is 3 after being incremented by subcrate.
VALUE is 4 after being incremented by subcrate_static_issue.
VALUE is 5 after being incremented by subcrate.
```
but instead I see:
```
VALUE is 1 after being incremented by subcrate_static_issue.
VALUE is 2 after being incremented by subcrate_static_issue.
VALUE is 1 after being incremented by subcrate.
VALUE is 3 after being incremented by subcrate_static_issue.
VALUE is 2 after being incremented by subcrate.
```
(I'm happy posting the contents of those files directly into this issue if preferred; I just didn't want to clutter the main report too much)
